title: Star Wars Games: Past, Present, and Future - The Blessing Show
description:
The force is strong with new Star Wars video games now that there's a new hope. In this episode of The Blessing Show, Blessing breaks down what's up with Lucasfilm Games and Star Wars.

Subscribe! http://www.youtube.com/kindafunnygames?sub_confirmation=1

Support us and get the shows early here! http://www.patreon.com/kindafunnygames

Check out our store! http://www.kindafunny.com/store

Follow us on Twitter!
Blessing - http://www.twitter.com/BlessingJr
Roger - http://www.twitter.com/Rogformer
Kinda Funny - http://www.twitter.com/KindaFunnyVids

Blessing breaks down what's up in the world of video games.

transcript_chunks.text: coming up next on their 20th anniversary the star wars movies are coming back with freshly restored prince of the galaxy depends on how you play the game you're piloting the naboo fighter i've seen dead ants in infinite space there's something special about flying through space and taking on darth vader and having lightsaber duels welcome to the blessing show where i break down what's up so let's talk about what's up with lucy's film games and star wars [Applause] [Music] jedi the force sith the empire these are all terms that we know and understand star wars is about as pop as pop culture gets and star wars video games in my opinion sit right alongside the movies shows and comics as a valued extension of the franchise with the revival of lucasfilm games this brings a new future for star wars games and i think it's a future worth diving into so let's talk about it [Music] some of my earliest gaming memories are of time spent at a friend's house playing star wars episode 1 racer on the

games and i think it's a future worth diving into so let's talk about it [Music] some of my earliest gaming memories are of time spent at a friend's house playing star wars episode 1 racer on the n64 that was actually my first experience playing a racing game at such high speeds along with vehicles that would explode if you ran them to a wall it was a blast i also remember other times spent at a different friend's house playing star wars demolition for the playstation one flash forward to me obtaining a playstation 2 and star wars battlefront those original battlefront games were nothing short of special multiplayer class based shooters where you deplete enemy troops by capturing command posts and blasting anyone in your way you could choose between playing as the empire the rebellion command storm troopers drive adapts summon play as luke skywalker drive a tank on naboo and truly live out the star wars fantasy star wars battlefront 2 on the ps2 remains one of my favorite games on the

storm troopers drive adapts summon play as luke skywalker drive a tank on naboo and truly live out the star wars fantasy star wars battlefront 2 on the ps2 remains one of my favorite games on the platform because more than anything the game was fantastic and served as an unexpected gateway to get me into multiplayer shooters what star wars demolition racer and battlefront all had in common were that they introduced me to a new type of game none of these games were wholly original but they were good except for maybe demolition and that's only scratching the surface of star wars games you've got star wars rogue squadron which is a beloved series of flight games the lego star wars games action games such as jedi academy force unleashed the old republic the mmo knights of the old republic the bioware rpg superstar awards for the snes and i've barely made a dent in this list according to this article there have been over 140 star wars games and what i think is cool is that all of these

the bioware rpg superstar awards for the snes and i've barely made a dent in this list according to this article there have been over 140 star wars games and what i think is cool is that all of these games are wildly different different stories different characters different genres and different platforms there are 2d star wars games 3d star wars games handheld vr prequel sequel original good bad and so on and so forth star wars sits next to mario gta final fantasy and whoever else you want to name as a storied video game franchise that said i understand why you wouldn't think of it in that way since 2013 electronic arts has held exclusive rights to make star wars games and since then it's been nothing short of a flawless concert generation's worth of star wars releases from that exclusivity deal we got the battlefront reboot in 2015 exciting yet in many ways didn't live up to the original games from pandemic studios we got a cancelled star wars game project ragtag which was being

deal we got the battlefront reboot in 2015 exciting yet in many ways didn't live up to the original games from pandemic studios we got a cancelled star wars game project ragtag which was being developed by visceral games along with amy hennig of uncharted fame we got star wars battlefront 2 which was the centerpiece of the big loot box controversy in 2017. that game went on to inspire legislation around microtransactions and randomized drops and we got star wars jedi fall in order which was a pretty good game albeit kind of buggy this isn't supposed to be the part of the video where i purely [ __ ] on ea reddit has that under control last year we got star wars squadrons which was a pretty cool flight sim and battlefront 2 has even been making big moves to maintain a healthy player base since its rocky launch it's just worth pointing out that the last generation of star wars games has been relatively unexciting at best and rocky at worst where are the bounty hunting games the bioware

its rocky launch it's just worth pointing out that the last generation of star wars games has been relatively unexciting at best and rocky at worst where are the bounty hunting games the bioware rpgs the speeder back races where is the flavor roger listen before ea all star wars games weren't great but we get a variety of them and getting to see different developers have different takes on star wars made the games more exciting than they have been for the last generation but there's a new hope we're entering a new era for star wars games lucasfilm games recently announced that they'll be the new umbrella under which star wars games will be released they're operating similarly to marvel games who are responsible for partnering with studios and publishers to figure out what fits best for marvel ip lucasfilm games has already announced their first star wars collaboration in the form of an open world star wars adventure developed by ubisoft massive the studio responsible for the division

ip lucasfilm games has already announced their first star wars collaboration in the form of an open world star wars adventure developed by ubisoft massive the studio responsible for the division they've also announced an indiana jones game but legally because of previous comments i'm not allowed to talk about it you've seen the internet jealous movies right nope hold on indiana jones has never like really been the thing that i feel like i've needed to watch yeah i got no desire i do want to watch the door of the explorer movie which i assume is very similar ubisoft massive star wars doesn't only read as an exciting prospect it feels like a promise of what's to come a story driven star wars game from the division team could be a third person action shooter from the perspective of the resistance maybe it's a games as a service where the world evolves over seasons maybe it's multiplayer or maybe it's an entirely single player open world action game like assassin's creed but you play as a

maybe it's a games as a service where the world evolves over seasons maybe it's multiplayer or maybe it's an entirely single player open world action game like assassin's creed but you play as a brand new original character wielding a cool sword or a bow staff much like how the possibilities are open for what ub massive star wars game could be the same can be said for star wars future in general what does a fast-paced star wars action game look like in the hands of platinum games what could we get from a star wars racing game developed by codemasters what can a star wars roguelite in the vein of hades look like where you play as darth maul escaping the depths of dathomir and what pressure does that put on the ea to make jedi fall in order 2 even bigger and better when there's competition in their midst believe it or not i don't really consider myself a big fan of the star wars movies i think they're fun hollywood blockbusters and i acknowledge their place in film history but i

in their midst believe it or not i don't really consider myself a big fan of the star wars movies i think they're fun hollywood blockbusters and i acknowledge their place in film history but i personally find it really hard to get invested i wouldn't say the same thing about the video games though there's something about star wars that just makes an exciting video game be it the flashiness of the visuals laser swords gun fights magic and the grandiose tri-tale of war and good versus evil i think the world of star wars is more of a fun one to play in for me than to watch so i'm excited about what's next for star wars video games whether that be jedi fallen order 2 and open world ubisoft game or whatever else may be in store but for now we'll have to wait and see [Music] you
